question: Question_Section_102_07_(d)
statement:
Decide whether or not the following statement is true or false. If true,
give a proof. If false, give a counterexample.

\textbf{(d)} For every \emph{5x5} matrix \emph{A} with real entries,

\[\displaystyle
\mathrm{det}(A^T A) \geq 0.\]
sols:
TRUE.

Proof:

Note 1:Since A is a square matrix, we know that
$\displaystyle \text{det}(AB) = \text{det}(A)\text{det}(B)$ is true.

Note 2: Since A is a square matrix, we also know that
$\displaystyle \text{det}(A^T) = \text{det}(A)$ and hence

$\displaystyle \text{det}(A^TA) = \text{det}(A^T)\text{det}(A) = \text{det}(A)\text{det}(A) = \text{det}(A)^2$

Since the determinant is squared, this means that the number is always
positive.

i.e. $\text{det}(A)^2 \geqslant 0$

$\therefore \text{det}(A^TA) \geqslant 0$.
hints:
Show that the left hand side of the problem is actually the square of a
real number.
